publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-431 Mr Gil Paterson: Mike Tyson—That the Parliament notes with grave concern the deplorable action taken by the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, in granting Mike Tyson, a convicted rapist, entry into the UK; recognises the great disrespect that this action shows to victims of rape; calls upon the Home Secretary to reverse his decision and to ensure that in the future financial reasons do not take precedence over ethical and legal reasons when considering the entry of convicted criminals into the UK, and congratulates Justice for Women for their action taken in the High Court to attempt to have this decision overturned.

S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Alasdair Morgan*, Alex Neil*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Irene McGugan*, Shona Robison*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Fergus Ewing*
S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Mike Watson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Colin Campbell*

S1M-431 Mr Gil Paterson: Mike Tyson—That the Parliament notes with grave concern the deplorable action taken by the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, in granting Mike Tyson, a convicted rapist, entry into the UK; recognises the great disrespect that this action shows to victims of rape; calls upon the Home Secretary to reverse his decision and to ensure that in the future financial reasons do not take precedence over ethical and legal reasons when considering the entry of convicted criminals into the UK, and congratulates Justice for Women for their action taken in the High Court to attempt to have this decision overturned. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Linda Fabiani, Tricia Marwick, Dr Winnie Ewing, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Mike Watson, Tommy Sheridan, Colin Campbell
S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Ms Sandra White*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-431 Mr Gil Paterson: Mike Tyson—That the Parliament notes with grave concern the deplorable action taken by the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, in granting Mike Tyson, a convicted rapist, entry into the UK; recognises the great disrespect that this action shows to victims of rape; calls upon the Home Secretary to reverse his decision and to ensure that in the future financial reasons do not take precedence over ethical and legal reasons when considering the entry of convicted criminals into the UK, and congratulates Justice for Women for their action taken in the High Court to attempt to have this decision overturned. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Linda Fabiani, Tricia Marwick, Dr Winnie Ewing, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Mike Watson, Tommy Sheridan, Colin Campbell, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Christine Grahame, Nick Johnston*
S1M-431 Mike Tyson (lodged on 17 January 2000) Mr David Davidson*
